鰓字的基本解释

鰓
sāi

鰓字的汉语字典释义

[①]［sāi］
［《廣韻》蘇來切，平咍，心。］
“鳃1”的繁体字。
(1)鱼类的呼吸器官。在头部的两侧，多为羽毛状、板状或丝状，用来吸取溶解在水中的氧。
(2)代称鱼。
[②]［xǐ］
“鳃2”的繁体字。同“葸1”。
恐惧，畏难。

鰓字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【魚字部】　鰓； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页1475第08
【廣韻】蘇來切【集韻】【韻會】桑才切，?音顋。魚頰中骨也。【宋史·五行志】淳化三年，京師里老婦女，裝鏤魚鰓中骨，號魚媚子。又【前漢·?法志】鰓鰓常恐。【註】鰓音葸，懼貌也。

Basic explanation of words

sāi
gill
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［sāi］
["Guangyun" Su Laiqie, flat 咍, heart. ]
Traditional characters for "Gill 1".
(1) The respiratory organs of fish. On both sides of the head, they are mostly feather-like, plate-like or filamentous, which are used to absorb oxygen dissolved in water.
(2) On behalf of the fish.
[②]［xǐ］
Traditional characters for "Gill 2". Same as "葸1".
Fear, fear of difficulties.
gill
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Fish Character Department] 　 gill; Kangxi strokes: 20; page number: page 1475 08
[Guang Yun] Su Laiqie [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Sang Caiqie,? Yin 顋. The bones in the cheeks of the fish are also. [Song History·Five Elements History] Three years in Chunhua, an old woman in the capital, dressed in fish gill bones, named Yumeizi. [Former Han·Fazhi] Gills are often scared. [Note] The gill sounds are quintessential, and they are also afraid of appearance.
